page.title: 08The Rector,Cannington
page.content: Our village rector has been a vicar since the age of 23;he is now 45 and has never regretted becoming a vicar. He finds it a very interesting job, but it sometimes has its bad sides . His family are affected by his low wages, which are just enough to keep his family. If he was not a vicar he would rather be a journilist.He was a teacher for a short time and also worked in a pub. He has about 3-5 services a day and more on a Sunday. He most dislikes holding funerals for small children. He lives in the rectory which is just across the road from the church.He has to get up at 7.30am each morning and go and ring the bells. After that he says morning prayer, then he holds a service.
